info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:26PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A LINE OF SHOWERS WILL AFFECT GUERNSEY...WESTERN MONROE... CARROLL...SOUTHEASTERN TUSCARAWAS...NOBLE...HARRISON...JEFFERSON... COLUMBIANA...SOUTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM...BELMONT...NORTHWESTERN BEAVER...MERCER...WESTERN LAWRENCE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 226 PM EST, radar indicated showers were located along a line extending from 7 miles west of Canfield to near McConnelsville. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. Winds in excess of 40 mph are possible with these showers. Locations impacted include... New Castle, Steubenville, Hermitage, Sharon, Salem, East Liverpool, Cambridge, Columbiana, Uhrichsville, St. Clairsville, East Palestine, and Sharpsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 178 and 218. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 16 and 48. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 120 and 138. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 18. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 4 and 14. These showers may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
